column4: Just finding a way to install the drivers that doesn't involve being Stephen Hawking is what I'm after

XGL? If I am I don't know about it

I've tried the thing that bot throws out, and its way more complicated than the method that worked for me before
This looks similar to a method I tried earlier today
I'll give it a blast though
And as I said before, I've tried the bots method and its beyond me, I'm a complete newbie to all this

Thats the package I tried to install today. You see this is a fresh install, I'm on 32-bit after ironically changing from my fully functional 64-bit setup hoping for some more simplicity
did you follow the 3 steps ati driver install how-to ?
bad approach, you should folow only one, and ask for help to figure what went wrong
you just need to install the drivers, and edit a text file to use it instead of the open source driver
did you checked that the driver was properly loaded ?
just to be safe, you did edit the xorg.conf, right ?
you dont need to compile unless your model is not supported by the current driver
, we are your guide now, did you changed xorg.conf ?
